definition: lit. to climb over the wall/fig. to breach the Great Firewall of China
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall

sentences.english: Grapple over the wall, run to the back and grapple onto the upper balcony.
sentences.chinese: 翻墙进去跑到后面然后用抓钩上到上层的阳台。

sentences.english: Night Yang who spy on misty rain over the wall, at the same time the misty rain guess fixed identity.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚阳明君翻墙偷看烟雨，同时烟雨猜出世子身份。

sentences.english: BingYin failed over the wall was hung on the wall, call for help.
sentences.chinese: 丙寅翻墙失败被挂在墙上，呼叫求救。

sentences.english: You don't go over the wall, though, not at Shawshank, not if you're smart.
sentences.chinese: 但是在肖申克，如果你够聪明的话，就不要翻墙越狱。

sentences.english: A thief climbed over the wall last night and stole some clothes.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚有一个贼翻墙进来，偷走了一些衣服。

sentences.english: The girl tore a hole in her dress climbing over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩翻墙时将连衣裙剐了一个洞。

sentences.english: Cons who go over the wall are stupid cons.
sentences.chinese: 想翻墙越狱的囚犯是蠢蛋。

sentences.english: Make your way through tunnels and secret rooms to ultimately steal across the yard and over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 你需要穿过隧道和秘室，通过院子后翻墙。

sentences.english: He color of face flashed a trace of guilt, and then ran away over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 兰博士脸上闪过一丝内疚之色，然后翻墙逃走。

definition: to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to pick a lock/to force a lock
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to take a shortcut
to break in/to force a door
(coll.) to use sb else's Internet connection (with or without permission)
to grope about in the dark
to lock/to lock up
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to lock the door
to steal/to commit a robbery
